content:
Diagnosis:
Right adrenal pheochromocytoma, pT3N0M0
Surgical resection 15 March 2024 - right adrenalectomy
Histology confirmed 8.5cm pheochromocytoma with capsular invasion
SDHA germline mutation identified

Previous medical history:
Hypertension - now resolved post surgery

Current medications:
None

Current situation:
First post-operative follow-up

I reviewed [redacted name] today following right adrenalectomy for pheochromocytoma. The post-operative period has been uncomplicated with excellent recovery. Blood pressure has normalized without need for antihypertensive medication. Surgical wound has healed well.

Plasma normetanephrine levels have returned to normal range at 420 pmol/L (previously 4500 pmol/L). CT scan on 20 April 2024 shows no evidence of residual or recurrent disease. Performance status is 0.

Given the identified SDHA mutation, genetic counselling has been arranged and family screening will be coordinated through the endocrine genetics service.

Plan is for biochemical surveillance with 3-monthly plasma metanephrines for the first year. Next clinic review in 3 months with repeat biochemistry. Annual CT surveillance will be arranged.

cancer_timeline.value: Initial plasma normetanephrine elevated at 4500 pmol/L
CT scan shows no evidence of residual or recurrent disease

status_updates.value: Right adrenal pheochromocytoma successfully treated with surgery. Post-operative recovery uncomplicated with normalization of biochemical markers
Complete biochemical response with normalization of plasma normetanephrine
3-monthly plasma metanephrines and annual CT surveillance
Clinic review in 3 months with repeat biochemistry, referral to endocrine genetics service for family screening
